title: Bihar: Woman collapses during home guard recruitment drive; allegedly gang-raped inside ambulance
content: A shocking incident occurred in Gaya district, Bihar. A 26-year-old woman reported a gang-rape. The crime allegedly happened in a moving ambulance. She collapsed during a Home Guard recruitment drive. The incident took place on July 24th. Police arrested two men swiftly after receiving the complaint. An investigation is currently underway.

title: Affair & poisoning: How missing bottle cap exposed 'suicide' as murder; wife, lover held
content: Initially appearing as a suicide near Kanva dam, the death of Lokesh Kumar, a former gram panchayat president, was cleverly disguised. However, observant police officers noticed missing details like the poison bottle cap and a missing slipper, raising suspicions.

title: 'Ashamed to support Bihar govt': Chirag Paswan flays NDA ally Nitish over rising crime
content: LJP (Ram Vilas) chief Chirag Paswan has criticized Bihar CM Nitish Kumar over the state's deteriorating law and order situation, even while his party remains a part of the NDA. Paswan's remarks follow a series of high-profile crimes in Bihar, leading the opposition to highlight potential rifts within the ruling alliance.

title: JD Vance on Al taking jobs: If robots are coming for our jobs, you would...
content: US Vice President JD Vance dismisses fears of AI-driven mass unemployment, asserting that current labor market trends don't support such claims. Speaking at the AI Action Summit in Paris, Vance argued that AI will augment human labor, boosting productivity and creating new job opportunities.

title: Nvidia CEO: Don't feel sad for my employees; I've created more billionaires than...
content: Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang boasts of creating numerous billionaires within his management team, attributing it to the success of focused AI research teams. He highlighted the significant impact of smaller, well-funded teams, citing examples like OpenAI and DeepSeek.

title: Uttarakhand: Landslide blocks Kedarnath route near Gaurikund; pilgrims halted
content: The trekking route to Kedarnath Dham, near Gaurikund, has been closed due to a landslide triggered by a hillock collapse on Friday night. The Public Works Department is working to clear the debris and restore the path. Security personnel are assisting pilgrims returning from Kedarnath, while those heading towards the shrine from Gaurikund have been stopped.

title: Prada-Kolhapuri row: Piyush Goyal says India will get due credit for its design
content: Union Minister Piyush Goyal announced that India will receive due recognition for its unique cultural products under the new FTA with the UK, citing the Prada-Kolhapuri chappal controversy. The government aims to protect and promote Indian GI products in global markets, with potential for significant international business.

title: Jeff Bezos sells $1.5 billion worth of Amazon shares, holds stock valued at...
content: Jeff Bezos recently sold 6.6 million Amazon shares worth $1.5 billion, as per an SEC filing. The sales occurred on July 21 and 22, before Amazon's Q2 earnings report. These transactions were executed under a prearranged 10b5-1 trading plan. Bezos intends to sell more shares, potentially up to 25 million by May 2026. He has already sold $4.

title: Piyush Goyal lauds India-UK FTA; calls it 'stepping stone towards Viksit Bharat'
content: Commerce Minister Piyush Goyal hailed the newly signed India-UK FTA as a "game-changing" agreement, offering significant opportunities for Indian farmers, businesses, and youth. The comprehensive FTA, awaiting UK Parliamentary approval, aims to eliminate duties on 99% of Indian exports to the UK.

title: 'Manifests savarn and shudras': MP HC flags 'caste system' in judiciary
content: ​​The court also criticised what it described as a "caste system" within the judicial setup, where high court judges are seen as "savarn" and district judges as "shudras" and "les misérables."

title: IND vs ENG: Jagadeesan gets visa, will leave tomorrow as Pant's injury cover
content: Narayan Jagadeesan is set to join the India squad in England as cover for the injured Rishabh Pant, who fractured his toe. Despite competition from other players, Jagadeesan's consistent performance and strong mental fortitude earned him the call-up. His coach highlights his discipline and process-oriented approach, while the Indian team grapples with multiple injury concerns during the ongoing tour.

title: 'Saiyaara’ BO collection day 9 (Live): Mohit Suri’s film set to cross Rs 200cr?
content: Mohit Suri's 'Saiyaara,' starring newcomers Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, is a box office sensation, poised to cross Rs 200 crore on its second Saturday. The film's strong emotional narrative and music have resonated with audiences, propelling it into the Top 50 Hindi films. Akshay Kumar praised the film, highlighting the success of fresh talent in Bollywood.

title: EU sanctions on Russia oil: Indian arm of UAE-based shipping company takes a hit
content: The EU has imposed sanctions on Intershipping Services Hub, an Indian subsidiary of a UAE-based firm, and Captain Abhinav Kamal for allegedly aiding Russian oil trade. These sanctions, limited to EU entities, freeze European assets and restrict business dealings.

title: Mohit Suri’s ‘Saiyaara’ becomes 2025’s second-biggest hit, beats 'Housefull 5'
content: Mohit Suri's Saiyaara is a box office hit. The film stars Ahaan Pandya and Aneet Padda. Saiyaara has earned Rs 190.25 crore in just eight days. It surpassed Housefull 5 collections. Experts predict a Rs 250 crore lifetime run. The film's success continues due to postponed releases. Saiyaara's second Friday earned Rs 17.50 crore.

title: 'Forever indebted': Tributes pour in from cricketers, IPL teams on Kargil Vijay Diwas
content: India commemorated the anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas, honouring the Indian armed forces' bravery and victory in the 1999 Kargil War. Former cricketers like Sachin Tendulkar and VVS Laxman, along with IPL teams such as Chennai Super Kings and Mumbai Indians, paid tribute to the soldiers' sacrifices on social media.

title: Kiss cam scandal: Astronomer teams up with Chris Martin's ex-wife Gwyneth Paltrow
content: Following a viral kiss cam incident involving its CEO and HR head at a Coldplay concert, tech company Astronomer has hired Gwyneth Paltrow as a temporary spokesperson. Paltrow's appearance in a promotional video aims to deflect attention from the scandal with humor. The company hopes to leverage the unexpected publicity, despite mixed reactions to the PR stunt.

title: Happy Hariyali Teej 2025 top 50 wishes, messages, and quotes
content: Hariyali Teej is a beautiful reminder of resilience, devotion, and the power of love. To honour the sacred bond of Lord Shiva and Goddess Parvati, fill your day with captivating messages, wishes, and quotes that spread joy, love, and sheer blessings.

title: ‘OBCs will have to think ...’: Cong leader likens Rahul to Ambedkar; BJP slams comparison
content: The BJP has intensified its criticism of Congress following Udit Raj's statement suggesting Rahul Gandhi could become a "second Ambedkar" with OBC support. Amit Malviya accused Congress of plotting to diminish Ambedkar's legacy, while Rahul Gandhi acknowledged his past failure to protect the OBC community and pledged to rectify it with a caste census.

title: 'Teams win because of combinations, not ...': Sidhu slams Gambhir's tactics
content: Former cricketer Navjot Singh Sidhu has strongly criticised Gautam Gambhir's team selection strategy during the ongoing Test series against England, particularly in the fourth Test. Sidhu expressed frustration over the frequent changes in the team composition, which he believes has disrupted the team's rhythm and hindered their ability to perform collectively.

title: India-UK trade deal: States, sectors set to gain from tariff cuts- see list
content: India and the UK are signing a trade agreement. This deal will remove tariffs and make trade easier. Maharashtra will export more engineering goods and medicines. Gujarat will see growth in pharma and seafood exports. Tamil Nadu's textile and leather industries will benefit. Other states like Andhra Pradesh and Punjab will also experience export growth.

title: Cambodia calls for immediate ceasefire with Thailand; 13 killed in border clashes
content: Cambodia urged an immediate ceasefire with Thailand following two days of intense cross-border conflict. The clashes occurred near the Preah Vihear and Prasat Ta Muen Thom temples. Both nations exchanged rockets and artillery fire. The United Nations Security Council addressed the situation. Casualties included soldiers and civilians on both sides.

title: ‘We are underpaid’: Stephen Curry sparks salary debate
content: Stephen Curry ignited a debate about NBA player compensation by suggesting that stars are underpaid relative to the league's soaring valuations. He argued that the current CBA structure prevents players from participating in equity, limiting their potential earnings. Curry believes players deserve a share in the league's financial success, advocating for changes to the CBA.

title: Democratic Leader Approval Ratings: PM Modi tops global list again; where does Trump rank?
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi continues to be the most popular global leader, securing a 75% approval rating according to Morning Consult's latest data from July 4-10, 2025. He is followed by South Korean President Lee Jae Myung and Argentina's Javier Milei.

title: Maharashtra horror: HIV+ girl raped for 2 years by care-home staffer; forced to abort
content: Latur police are investigating a harrowing case involving a 16-year-old HIV positive girl who alleges repeated rape by a staffer at her residential facility over two years. She was also forced to undergo an abortion. The facility's director, his wife, and another staffer have been arrested for allegedly suppressing the matter.

title: WATCH: Bumrah's staircase stumble triggers major injury scare for India
content: India faced injury concerns on Day 3 of the fourth Test as Jasprit Bumrah appeared to hurt his ankle, while Mohammed Siraj also struggled with discomfort. England capitalised, with Joe Root's magnificent 150 propelling them to a commanding 544/7, establishing a substantial 186-run lead. Ben Stokes remained unbeaten, steering England towards a potential series-clinching victory.

title: 'Missed important meeting': Air India flyers spend 2 hours in plane after taxiing
content: An Air India flight (AI-2982) from Delhi to Pune experienced a technical issue on Friday, causing significant delays for its 150 passengers. After taxiing, the Airbus A-320 returned to the bay, leaving passengers waiting anxiously for two hours. Passengers expressed frustration over the lack of communication and missed business meetings.

title: IND v ENG | Weather Updates: Will rain hurt India's chances on Day 4?
content: The weather forecast for Day 4 of the crucial India vs England fourth Test at Old Trafford predicts light rain in the morning, potentially impacting India's batting performance as they trail in the series.

title: ITC announces Rs 20,000cr investment push: Focus on FMCG margin boost
content: ITC Ltd. is set to invest Rs 20,000 crore across its diverse business sectors over the next five to six years, following the inauguration of eight new manufacturing facilities. The company, having already invested ₹4,500 crore in capex over the last two years, is also eyeing potential acquisitions to bolster growth.

title: 'We told sir bricks were falling': Students raised alarm before Rajasthan school collapsed; 7 dead
content: In a tragic incident in Piplodi, Jhalawar, a classroom ceiling collapse at a government school resulted in the deaths of seven children and injuries to over 20 others. Villagers reported the school building was in disrepair for decades and teachers ignored students' warnings about the dangerous conditions.

title: 'Boasted friendship...': Jairam Ramesh targets PM Modi; lists '4 facts'
content: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh has strongly criticized Prime Minister Modi's foreign policy, citing recent US actions involving Pakistan as evidence of its failure. Ramesh highlighted President Trump's claims of intervening in India-Pakistan conflict, US Central Command's praise for Pakistan's counter-terrorism efforts, and meetings between US officials and Pakistani leaders.

title: 'Beyond India now': Ex-England cricketer questions Shubman Gill's tactics
content: England dominated India in the fourth Test at Old Trafford, with Joe Root's impressive 150 putting them in a commanding lead. Jonathan Trott highlighted India's bowling struggles, particularly the lack of support for Bumrah. Shubman Gill faced a tough captaincy challenge on his first England tour. Sanjay Manjrekar urged India to fight back, despite the uneven bounce of the pitch.

title: ‘Stop immigration and … wind mills’: Trump tells Europe to get its ‘act together’
content: Donald Trump visited Scotland for five days. He spoke about immigration in Europe. Trump criticised wind energy and praised his administration's immigration policies. He visited his golf courses. Trump is scheduled to meet UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer. He has family ties to Scotland. A state visit is planned for September.

title: 'He'll break Tendulkar's record in 2027': Vaughan's bold prediction for Root
content: Joe Root's magnificent 150 in the fourth Test propelled him past Dravid, Kallis, and Ponting, securing the second-highest run-scorer position in Test cricket. Michael Vaughan boldly predicted Root would surpass Sachin Tendulkar's record in 2027, while Ricky Ponting also supported Root's potential to become No. 1. Root's 38th century ties him with Sangakkara, potentially shaping the series outcome.

title: Karnataka Bhavan row: Siddaramaiah, DKS aides clash in Delhi
content: A public dispute erupted in Delhi between aides of Karnataka's Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and Deputy CM DK Shivakumar at Karnataka Bhavan. The confrontation involved alleged threats and abusive language, leading to formal complaints and calls for an inquiry. The Chief Minister has directed an investigation into the matter following complaints from women staff regarding the DCM's aide's behavior.

title: ‘Joote khane bhej dia...’: When Pak DGMO came for key talks; how the meet helped end the Kargil War
content: In July 1999, as Pakistani troops retreated during the Kargil War, PM Vajpayee arranged a DGMO-level meeting at Attari. Lt Gen Bhandari recalls his surprise at seeing Pak DGMO Lt Gen Zia arrive alone, lamenting he was sent to 'take the blows' by PM Nawaz Sharif.

title: Watch | De Villiers names top batters and bowlers across formats: 'Kallis, ...'
content: AB de Villiers, the South African legend, recently shared his all-time top three batters and bowlers across all formats, sparking debate among cricket fans. His picks for batters include Jacques Kallis, Ricky Ponting, and Virat Kohli, while his bowlers list features Mohammad Asif, Dale Steyn, and Glenn McGrath.

title: Cambodia-Thailand conflict: Indian embassy issues advisory; shares helpline numbers
content: The Indian embassy in Cambodia has advised its citizens to avoid traveling to the Cambodia-Thailand border due to ongoing clashes. Similar advisory was issued by the Indian embassy in Thailand, urging travelers to stay updated on local conditions. The conflict has resulted in numerous casualties and displacement of thousands, prompting international concern and a United Nations Security Council emergency meeting.

title: Who is Aaron ‘Tex’ Johnson? MMA fighter removed from plane after outburst
content: MMA fighter Aaron "Tex" Johnson was removed from a Southwest Airlines flight at LaGuardia Airport following a heated dispute over baggage, captured in a viral video. Johnson's outburst included shouting at airline staff and arguing with passengers, leading to a disorderly conduct summons. In this article, we also take a look at his personal life and fighting career.

title: Kerala jailbreak: Officials clueless on how Govindachamy escaped prison; found hiding in well
content: Govindachamy, a life convict notorious for the 2011 rape and murder case, escaped from Kannur Central Prison early Friday. Authorities discovered his absence during a morning inspection, finding clothes hanging from the prison wall. A statewide manhunt was launched, leading to his apprehension within hours after a local resident's tip-off.

title: Bus operators seek action against illegal parking along Kozhikode-Kuttiyadi route
content: They allege that the merchants and auditorium owners are responsible for creating moving bottlenecks on the accident-prone route

title: Peace and normalcy returning to Manipur, says Governor Ajay Kumar Bhalla
content: Mr. Bhalla was speaking at an event in Imphal organised to commemorate the 26th anniversary of Kargil Vijay Diwas.

title: Any of the 11 documents accepted for SIR verification are susceptible to falsification: petitioner counters EC in Supreme Court
content: The Election Commission had refused to accept Aadhaar, Voter ID, and ration card for the Bihar SIR on the grounds that they were prone to fraud

title: Sankara Nethralaya pays tribute to Dr. Namperumalsamy
content: ‘Dr. Nam’, as he was fondly known, was chairman-emeritus of Madurai-based Aravind Eye Hospital. He died on Thursday (July 25, 2025) at the age of 85

title: Kerala HC directs police to train personnel and equip them for using e-Sakshya or other platforms to document crime scenes
content: e-Sakshya assists the police in recording crime scenes, searches, and seizures, and to upload them to a cloud-based platform

title: T.N. government may start land acquisition for Hosur airport in three months
content: The consultant hired by the State government has submitted the Obstacle Limitation Surfaces (OLS) survey for two sites identified recently, and the administration is expected to finalise the location within a month and a half

title: KLE Society’s contribution to Belagavi immense: Minister Laxmi Hebbalkar
content: Minister for Women and Child Development Laxmi Hebbalkar has said that contribution of KLE Society to the growth of Belagavi was immense and because of it Belagavi was shining on the world map.

title: Government should focus on re-enrollment of dropout students: APTF
content: Bankuru Joginaidu said that the parents who joined their kids in private schools would again send them back to government schools if steps were taken to appoint at least two teachers for each school.

title: CM Siddaramaiah says Congress developed Mysuru more than the BJP
content: The CM maintained that during the Congress party rule, the government did much development work in Mysuru. However, the BJP government did not develop Mysuru when they were in power.

title: Rain triggers a trail of destruction in Kerala; train services halted at Alappuzha; Orange alert for seven districts on Saturday
content: Train traffic to Ernakulam from Thiruvananthapuram via Alappuzha disrupted after tree fell reported near Mararikulam by 8.30 a.m.

title: Andhra’s first commercially-licensed mini theatre thrown open near Rajamahendravaram
content: Collaborated with Qube cinema, the 20-seat capacity theatre is exclusively meant for families and group of audience at a government-fixed ticket cost

title: Two-member special team headed by former HC judge to probe Govindachamy’s jailbreak
content: A comprehensive investigation will be conducted by a special team headed by former Kerala High Court Judge Justice Retd. C.N. Ramachandran Nair and former State police chief Jacob Punnoose

title: India-U.K. free trade agreement ‘game-changing’, every section to benefit, says Piyush Goyal
content: India-U.K. Free Trade Agreement (FTA) was signed by Mr. Goyal and his counterpart Jonathan Reynolds in the presence of Prime Minister Narendra Modi and British Prime Minister Keir Starmer

title: Bihar Military Police aspirant alleges gang-rape in ambulance en route to hospital in Bihar
content: Two persons arrested in Bodh Gaya; SIT formed to probe incident; Opposition targets Nitish Kumar government over law and order

title: Gujarat Congress camp: Rahul Gandhi blames ‘biased umpire’ ECI for poll defeats; slams BJP-RSS ‘control’
content: Rahul Gandhi assured the district unit chiefs of his party in Gujarat that their opinions will be taken into account while selecting poll candidates

title: Applications invited for JRF posts by Lakireddy Hanimireddy Degree College at Mylavaram
content: In a statement, project Director J. Ramudu said the candidates must have completed M.Sc in Botany/Plant Sciences/Plant Biotechnology

title: Flood alert in Chintoor Agency as water level on the rise in Godavari
content: The relief camps will be opened only after the first flood warning at Bhadrachalam in Telangana State

title: CM Naidu congratulates Ashok Gajapathi Raju on being sworn in as Goa Governor
content: AP CM N. Chandrababu Naidu expressed confidence that Mr. Gajapathi Raju would carry out his new responsibilities with the same dedication and impartiality and stand as an example to others

title: 17 MPs honoured with Sansad Ratna Awards for Parliamentary performance
content: The honours also include four Special Jury Awards, recognising their consistent contributions to parliamentary democracy across three successive terms

title: Maoist SZCM, East Bastar division in-charge Nagaraju, his wife Aruna surrendered before DGP Harish Kumar Gupta
content: “The couple is involved in several cases and carries a reward of ₹20 lakh and ₹5 lakh respectively,” says DGP Harish Kumar Gupta

title: Ashok Gajapathi Raju takes oath as Goa Governor
content: Former Union Minister Ashok Gajapathi Raju sworn in as Governor of Goa, succeeding P.S. Sreedharan Pillai, vows to serve people

title: CAG data indicates Andhra Pradesh’s worsened fiscal stress: Jagan
content: It is quite apparent that the economic buoyancy of the State is lost, as evident from the abysmally low growth across some categories of State Government revenues and negative growth in others, says Former CM Y.S. Jagan Mohan Reddy

title: Thunderstorm alert in 25 Telangana districts on July 27
content: Meanwhile, Hyderabad and its surrounding areas, for the next 24 hours will see a generally cloudy sky.

title: Gusty winds hit rural areas of Kozhikode district
content: Several houses have been damaged in Nadapuram, Thiruvambai, Mukkom and Koodaranhi areas apart from disrupting the power supply

title: IMD predicts heavy rainfall in Mumbai, suburbs; red alert issued for Palghar
content: The IMD stated that heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely in the island city and suburbs till July 27 morning, with the possibility of occasional gusty winds reaching 40-50 kmph

title: Frequent disruptions in Parliament harm Opposition more than government: Kiren Rijiju
content: Negative news drives TRPs, not constructive action. It is a vicious cycle — both the MPs and the media are trapped in it, says Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju

title: Tendering process for Arebetta crossing station in final stages, SWR tells MP Srinivas Poojary
content: The crossing station on Subrahmanya Road-Sakleshpur Ghat section enhances train handling capacity through the Ghat

title: Search operations launched at Rajasthan CMO, Jaipur airport after bomb threat via email
content: "The anti-bomb squad, police, fire brigade and civil defence teams were swiftly deployed at both the Chief Minister's Office and the airport," a senior police officer said

title: Like with Operation Sindoor, India can bring ‘adversary’ to talking table with fewer than 50 weapons: VCAS Tiwari
content: "I think that is an example that should be studied, and I am sure it will be studied subsequently, maybe it is too short a time since the operation..." the Vice Chief of Air Staff said

title: India looks forward to boosting ties with Maldives, committed to support capacity building: PM Modi
content: PM Modi held wide-ranging talks with Maldivian President Mohamed Muizzu and announced a ₹4,850 crore line of credit to the island nation

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas reminds every Indian of unparalleled bravery, tenacity, patriotism of our soldiers: CDS Anil Chauhan
content: Chief of Defence Staff General Anil Chauhan pays tribute to Kargil War heroes and emphasises that Kargil Vijay Diwas is not just about remembering the past but also about drawing inspiration for the future

title: A's Kurtz becomes first rookie with 4-HR game
content: Nick Kurtz of the Athletics became the first rookie in MLB history to hit four home runs in a game, doing so in a 15-3 victory over the Astros. He also had six hits and 19 total bases.

title: Stewart to join Bengals as rookie reaches deal
content: Shemar Stewart agreed to a four-year, fully guaranteed contract worth $18.97 million with the Bengals as he became the final first-round draft pick to reach a deal.

title: Miami: Messi 'extremely upset' with MLS over ban
content: Inter Miami co-owner Jorge Mas said Lionel Messi is "extremely upset" after being given a one-game suspension by MLS for skipping the All-Star Game.

title: Liverpool sets Jota memorials, 'Forever 20' patch
content: Liverpool players will wear a "Forever 20" emblem on their shirts this season in memory of Diogo Jota who died in a car crash in Spain three weeks ago.

title: Verstappen wins first sprint since Horner's exit
content: Max Verstappen kicked off Red Bull's post-Christian Horner era with an impressive sprint race victory.

title: Sources: Around 100 NFLers face SB-tix penalty
content: At least 100 players face fines and possible suspension for allegedly selling their allotted tickets to this year's Super Bowl LIX above face value, sources told ESPN.

title: USC lands Hall, No. 1 hoops recruit in 2026 class
content: Saniyah Hall, the No. 1 player in the ESPNW class of 2026, announced her commitment to USC on ESPN's "NBA Today."

title: Goldschmidt regrets toss as Yanks errors persist
content: Paul Goldschmidt's off-balance throw was the Yankees' ninth error in four games as another loss dropped them 5½ games back in the AL East.

title: 💪 McGee's Mascot Power Rankings
content: From giant red blobs and 1,700-pound steer to coonskin caps and bears riding Harleys, these are the sport's top merrymakers.

title: Building the perfect trade deadline for the Mets and Phillies
content: New York and Philadelphia are battling for NL East domination. Here's how each can win next week's trade deadline.

title: Cameo guide: PGA stars, NFL champ, WWE icons and more
content: Nearly 30 years after the original, "Happy Gilmore 2" brings a who's who of stars from the PGA, NFL, NBA, WWE and more.

title: Return to your happy place: How Happy Gilmore's long-awaited sequel came to be
content: "Happy Gilmore 2" tees off 29 years later with sports stars, and a mission to honor the cult classic's legacy.

title: SEC preview: Alabama, Georgia, Texas, LSU ... this conference is wide open
content: The SEC never lacks for talent or storylines -- and there's no reason to think 2025 will be any different.

title: Can Florida repeat? How good will BYU be? Our men's hoops preview 100 days out
content: The Gators bolstered their roster, while the Cougars welcomed the top recruit. Here are 98 more things to know.

title: All-SEC Final Four? 100 predictions, more at 100 days until women's hoops
content: From the biggest storylines to the top players to watch, we preview the 2025-26 women's basketball season.

title: Baker Mayfield judges contest featuring mullets, mustaches and Crocs in 'sport mode'
content: The Buccaneers QB handed out a custom trophy -- with a mullet, mustache and all -- to the fan who best captured his undercover alter ego from "The Undercovers."

title: Who are the best NFL draft prospects for next year? Debating the No. 1 player at 11 positions
content: Who is the top quarterback, edge rusher and corner in the 2026 NFL draft class? We debated every position's early lead.

title: NBA summer storylines we're still watching, including the Kuminga saga at Golden State
content: The NBA's offseason flurry is winding down, but key restricted free agent and superstar extension decisions are still looming.

title: 'Pay Us What You Owe Us': Inside the WNBPA's statement-making All-Star Weekend
content: As CBA negotiations continue, WNBA players made a unified statement at the All-Star Game. Here's how they landed on "Pay Us What You Owe Us" shirts.

content: Expansion franchises have historically struggled in Year 1. But Golden State is fighting for a WNBA playoff spot.

content: Breaking down the fits of every top class of 2026 commitment, beginning with No. 1 Saniyah Hall to USC.

content: Hulk Hogan is arguably the most well-known professional wrestler of all time. Check out his top career accolades now.

content: Let's run through the people in the NFL who have the most to gain or lose this season, in terms of new contracts or new jobs.

title: Euro 2025 final preview: England vs. Spain, tactics, players, prediction
content: England and Spain have done this before: The Euro 2025 final is a rerun of the final from the 2023 World Cup, so we're in familiar territory.

title: What we're hearing in the transfer window: Man United considering Kolo Muani in striker search
content: The summer transfer window is open, but what are our reporters hearing about deals that could be done? Get the latest every Friday.

title: PLL Week 9 preview: Key stats, players for Archers' Homecoming
content: The PLL heads back to Salt Lake City on Friday and Saturday. Here's the full schedule, key stats, injury notes and more.

title: Reactions to MLB trade deadline deals
content: Track the fantasy fallout from all the key deals as we head towards the MLB trade deadline on Thursday, July 31.

title: Mock draft: Five QBs go in first round of 10-team superflex
content: The top signal-callers went early and quality wide receivers remained available in the middle rounds.

title: Key stats and numbers for Zayas-Garcia and 'Shu Shu'-Heita
content: Xander Zayas fights for his first world title, and Bruce Carrington for an interim belt. Here's a look at both fights through the numbers.

title: Ohio to Virginia: SportsCenter's 50-in-50 Week 5 quiz
content: Did someone say sports trivia? As "SportsCenter" continues its summer road trip, we're back for our fifth "state check."

title: From Drug Dealer To "Martyr", 2 J&K Cops Suspended For Killing Tribal Man
content: Two policemen have been suspended after killing a tribal man in an alleged staged encounter in Jammu and Kashmir. The killing of Mohammad Parvaz sparked widespread protests and outrage in Jammu and Kashmir.

title: India, Maldives Hit Reset, A Year After Diplomatic Ties Hit All-Time Low
content: A year after India-Maldives relations hit a historic low, the two countries appear to have reset the trajectory of their bilateral ties.

title: "Sad To Support A Regime Where...": Chirag Paswan Tears Into Nitish Kumar
content: Union Minister and Lok Janshakti Party (Ram Vilas) President Chirag Paswan on Saturday strongly criticised the Nitish Kumar-led Bihar government over the deteriorating law and order situation in the state.

title: Karnataka Power Play Spills Over To Delhi With A 'Babu vs Babu' Clash
content: A clash between two senior Karnataka government officials stationed at Karnataka Bhavan in Delhi has triggered a political storm, amid underlying tensions between Chief Minister Siddaramaiah and his deputy, DK Shivakumar.

title: Bihar Woman Faints During Home Guard Test, Gang-Raped In Moving Ambulance
content: A 26-year-old woman participating in a Home Guard recruitment drive in Bihar's Gaya district was allegedly gang-raped in a moving ambulance while being transported to a hospital after collapsing during a physical test.

title: 5 Civilians Killed In 'Terrorist' Attack In Iran, 3 Gunmen Then Shot Dead
content: According to Alireza Daliri, deputy police commander of Sistan-Baluchistan province, the attackers attempted to enter the building disguised as visitors.

title: "PM Modi Wants To Make Cholas Global, DMK Keeping Them Local": K Annamalai To NDTV
content: K Annamalai spoke to NDTV ahead of PM Modi's visit to Tiruchirappalli to attend a mega festival to celebrate the legacy of Chola emperor Rajendra Chola I.

title: Indian Student Dies By Suicide In London, Body Brought Back To Telangana
content: The body of an Indian student in London, who died by suicide earlier this month, reportedly due to emotional distress, has been brought back to his hometown in Telangana's Mahabubabad.

title: Outrage In China After Men Share Non-Consensual Intimate Pics Of Partners On Telegram
content: Pornography in China is illegal, and conservative social attitudes towards women remain the norm, often reinforced by state media and popular culture.

title: PM Modi Meets Maldives Political Leaders, Talks Focus On Mahasagar Vision
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi held a meeting with members of several political parties of the Maldives on Saturday.

title: Earth Imaging Satellite NISAR Exposes NASA's Weaknesses, ISRO's Strengths
content: Wendy Edelstein, NISAR's Deputy Project Manager at NASA's Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL), asserted, "NISAR is a 50-50 partnership between NASA and ISRO".

title: Uttar Pradesh Government Razes Illegal Property Of Chhangur Baba's Nephew
content: The Balrampur district administration in Uttar Pradesh on Saturday demolished an illegal structure belonging to Sabroz, nephew of Chhangur alias Jalaluddin, who is accused of running a large-scale religious conversion racket.

title: Turning Fear Into Faith: Truth Behind Bhopal's 'Hindu Exodus' Claim
content: On the morning of July 24, the narrow, crowded alleys of Bhopal's Banganga area suddenly turned into a theatre of chants and colour.

title: Family Of 4, Including 2 Teens, Die By Suicide In Madhya Pradesh
content: Four members of a family, including a 45-year-old man and his two teenage children, allegedly committed suicide on Saturday by consuming sulphas tablets in Sagar district of Madhya Pradesh, police said.

title: "Lok Sabha To First Take Up Motion To Remove Justice Yashwant Verma": Kiren Rijiju
content: Union Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju stated that the motion to remove Justice Yashwant Verma, who remains in trouble after burnt wads of cash were recovered from his residence following a fire incident, will be moved in Lok Sabha first.

title: India To Open Cho La For 'Battlefield Tourism': Top Sikkim Official
content: India will open Cho La in Sikkim to tourists as part of its Ranbhoomi or battlefield tourism initiative, a top officer in the Sikkim government said on Friday.

title: Travelling To Thailand, Cambodia Amid Clashes? Avoid These Areas
content: A long-standing border dispute between Thailand and Cambodia escalated on Thursday, following years of tensions over contested territory.

title: Bengaluru's 'Empire Kababs' Flagged Unsafe By Food Safety Body
content: Bengaluru's popular Empire restaurant chain has landed in soup after a lab report from the State Food Laboratory, Public Health Institute, declared that chicken kebabs served at its Gandhinagar outlet were unsafe for human consumption.

title: In UP Horror, Wife Poisons Husband Twice, Lover Involved In Murder Plot
content: In a shocking incident in Firozabad's Ulau village, a young man named Sunil succumbed to poisoning, allegedly administered by his wife and her lover.

title: The Story Of Maldives' Independence: A Look At The Islands' Colonial Past
content: PM Narendra Modi is in the Maldives as the Guest of Honour for the country's 60th Independence Day celebrations.

title: T.N. tribal woman, untraceable for 10 days, delivers healthy baby in Chamarajanagar hospital
content: Following repeated counselling and persistent efforts by S. Kannaiyan, president of the Thalavadi Farmers’ Foundation, Shevanthi had eventually returned home

title: Caste, feudal systems still reflect in MP judiciary where district judges treated as 'shudras': HC
content: The bench likened the relationship between the judges of the High Court and those of the district courts to that of “feudal lord and serf”

title: Operation Sindoor strikes sent clear message to Pakistan: Army chief Upendra Dwivedi
content: Addressing a gathering on Vijay Diwas, the Chief of Army Staff said a stern response to the adversary was the new normal established by India.

title: Mortal remains of trainee pilot killed in Canada flown in
content: The youngster was killed after his flight collided with another during a practice flying session in Manitoba province, Canada on July 8. May Royes, 20, from Canada, was the other victim.

title: Father, daughter killed in road accident in Shadnagar
content: The accident was reported around 7.30 a.m. when the two were travelling on a two-wheeler from their residence to the college on the Hyderabad-Mahbubnagar road.

title: Three Maoists killed in gunfight with security forces in Jharkhand
content: Intelligence inputs were received that members of Jharkhand Jan Mukti Parishad (JJMP), a splinter group of CPI (Maoist), had gathered at the Ghaghra forest and were planning an attack on security forces

title: Rahul Gandhi's concern for Dalits self-serving: Mayawati
content: Mayawati said that it was this very behaviour of the Congress party that compelled Dalits to form their own party

title: Hyderabad Weather July 26 | City wakes to morning rain, waterlogging slows traffic in multiple areas
content: The Hyderabad Traffic Police reported waterlogging and consequent traffic congestion at key junctions including Ayodhya Junction, Abids, Ranigunj and Saifabad.

title: Water level rises in Godavari; officials sound alert in Agency habitations of Andhra Pradesh’s Eluru district
content: Water level in Godavari was recorded at 35 feet at Bhadrachalam, says the Irrigation Department officials

title: Man held with firearm and bullets at Nagpur airport
content: The accused, identified as Anil Shrikrishna Porad, is the president of the Tribal Cell of a political party. He is a resident of Yavatmal in eastern Maharashtra, a police official said

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas: Chief of Army Staff Gen Dwivedi launches three projects to pay tributes to Kargil martyrs
content: Gen. Upendra Dwivedi launched three projects, including a portal where people can pay ‘e-shradhanjali’ to martyrs, as part of the 26th Kargil Vijay Diwas

title: CBI busts cybercrime gang operating from Pune apartments; three arrested
content: The Central Bureau of Investigation arrests cybercrime syndicate defrauding U.S. citizens, seizing cash, narcotics, and incriminating digital evidence in Pune and Mumbai raids

title: Andhra Pradesh Government aims to redefine tourism
content: Andhra Pradesh gears up to celebrate World Tourism Day on September 27, 2025 and a compelling theme would be unveiled by the CM Chandrababu Naidu

title: Bihar Assembly polls: Nitish government hikes monthly pension of retired journalists by ₹9,000 to ₹15,000
content: In the event of the death of a journalist receiving pension under the scheme, instructions have been given to provide their dependent/spouse with a lifetime monthly pension of ₹10,000 instead of the earlier amount of ₹3,000

title: Man ‘rapes’ minor neighbour in U.P.’s Banda, held after encounter
content: The police team surrounded the accused, who opened fire, leading to retaliation and the accused being shot in both legs

title: Cyclone havoc in Kannur: Elderly man killed, fisherman missing
content: The deceased has been identified as Eniyadan Chandran of Peruva Thettumal. The incident occurred around 2 a.m. when strong winds uprooted a tree that crashed onto his residence.

title: KKCCI seeks early environmental clearance for PM-Mitra Mega Textile Park
content: The Chamber reminded the Minister that although the prestigious PM-Mitra Mega Textile Park project was sanctioned for Kalaburagi in 2023, there has been little tangible progress on the ground over the past two years.

title: PM Modi's 'friendship' with President Trump proving to be hollow: Congress
content: The abject failure of Indian diplomacy, especially in the past two months, is revealed most tellingly by four facts. These expose the tall claims made by the Prime Minister and his drum-beaters and cheerleaders, says Congress leader Jairam Ramesh

title: Kargil Vijay Diwas: President Murmu, PM Modi lead nation to pay tributes to martyrs on 26th anniversary of ‘Operation Vijay’
content: On July 26, 1999, the Indian Army announced the successful culmination of “Operation Vijay”, declaring victory after a nearly three-month-long battle on the icy heights of Kargil in Ladakh

title: Amit Shah tells security brass to bring back fugitives involved in terror, smuggling activities
content: Amit Shah stressed enhancing inter-agency coordination between central and state law enforcement agencies, besides recalibrating the approach towards disrupting domestic nodes of the terror-criminal nexus

title: Light rains and weekend rush cause traffic snarls across Hyderabad and Cyberabad
content: Officials from the Hyderabad Traffic Control Room reported an average delay of 5–6 minutes across busy junctions.

title: Rajasthan school building collapse: Rahul Gandhi demands probe, strict punishment for culprits
content: A regular morning that saw students assembling for prayers quickly turned into tragedy when a portion of their government school building collapsed, killing seven children and injuring 27, some of them critically

title: Govindachamy shifted to Viyyur Central Jail under heavy security a day after jailbreak and capture
content: The incident has raised serious questions about prison security protocol and the accuracy of routine checks in one of Kerala’s most fortified correctional facilities

title: ARTRAC commemorates 26 years of victory in Kargil War
content: The commemorative events of ‘Kargil Vijay Diwas’ were inaugurated in a solemn ceremony by Lieutenant General Devendra Sharma, General Officer Commanding-in-Chief, ARTRAC, Shimla

title: What happened to the crypto exchange CoinDCX? | Explained
content: The breach that affected the CoinDCX exchange came almost exactly one year after a security incident that brought operations at the crypto exchange WazirX to a standstill

title: Fertile fields or solar factory: a verdant land facing an industrial leap
content: Farmers and fisherfolk of the picturesque and fertile Karedu in SPSR Nellore district fear that the massive land acquisition for an ambitious industrial project may irrevocably hurt their livelihood, but the authorities are confident about hammering out a solution through dialogue and compensation

title: Gujarat: 16-year-old girl gangraped in Porbandar; duo arrested, two on the run
content: The incident took place on July 22, while a case was registered against four persons at Udyognagar police station on July 24

title: Depression over coastal West Bengal, extremely heavy rainfall, thunderstorms likely in the State: IMD
content: The IMD also issued a warning to the fisherfolk of West Bengal, advising them not to venture along and off North and central Bay of Bengal, and West Bengal and Odisha coasts between July 25 and July 29

title: Meghalaya HC seeks action after 3,950 MT coal vanishes from depots
content: The matter came to light in a report submitted by a committee tasked with monitoring coal mining and transportation issues in the State

title: After UNESCO recognition, Maharashtra to train locals as guides at Maratha Forts
content: On July 11, 2025, 11 forts in Maharashtra and 1 fort in Tamil Nadu, were granted UNESCO World Heritage Site status. The proposal for this recognition was prepared by the Directorate of Archaeology and Museums, Department of Cultural Affairs, Government of Maharashtra.

title: Engineering aspirants in West Bengal face uncertain future over delay in West Bengal entrance test results
content: Many worry over ‘lost opportunities’ for not opting for colleges that take admission through other entrance exams; professors apprehensive of losing out on the brightest talent

title: Two Class 10 girls found to be pregnant in Odisha’s Kandhamal
content: Majority of girls with ‘unusual’ symptoms undergo health check-ups after they join schools after vacation

title: 25 die daily from drowning in West Bengal, half are children: new study finds
content: Lack of awareness, poor rescue practices, and no supervision are driving avoidable child deaths, say experts

title: Bombay High Court dismisses petition against Maharashtra’s agri procurement scheme, calls them ‘baseless’
content: The Bombay High Court imposed a cost of ₹1 lakh on the petitioners for obstructing the implementation of a State action plan aimed at enhancing oilseed productivity

title: No protest, sloganeering in M.P. Assembly, says circular for Monsoon Session; Congress slams move
content: Slamming the move, Leader of Opposition in the Assembly Umang Singhar said that the decision was taken “under pressure from the government”

title: Plastic ban to be strictly enforced along Fort Kochi beach over pollution concerns
content: Action taken report submitted to the National Green Tribunal by the District Collector on July 21 says traders and vendors have been instructed to switch to eco-friendly alternatives

title: In Bihar, a matter of life and debt
content: In Bihar, increased borrowing from multiple sources, both institutional and informal lenders, has led to excessive debt burdens. Borrowers struggle to repay loans with high interest rates while dreading recovery agents, who intimidate and harass them. Sobhana K. Nair and T.C.A. Sharad Raghavan report on the lack of political thrust on bringing in any regulatory mechanism in the State that is set to go to the polls later this year

title: Kargil, Pahalgam and a revamp of the security strategy
content: If Kargil was a watershed moment in India’s conventional fighting capability, Pahalgam has set the bar against any terror attack in the future

title: CM Fadnavis meets Union Ministers in Delhi, seeks financial assistance for projects
content: During his two-day tour to Delhi, he met Union Home Minister Amit Shah, Union Health Minister and BJP National President J.P. Nadda, Union Defence Minister Rajnath Singh, Union Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman, Union Agriculture Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan, and NITI Aayog officials

title: Draft data protection rules have received almost 7,000 comments: IT Ministry
content: Comments will not be released publicly, to allow for candid submissions; the Rules, needed to enforce the 2023 Digital Personal Data Protection Act, are yet to be notified seven months after the draft was published

title: Gram panchayat member who ‘planned’ husband’s murder arrested
content: Poison bottle with missing lid, missing slipper, and call record details help police unravel murder mystery; five men who allegedly orchestrated the murder held

title: Clash of Clans Summer Jam offers players the chance to join Travis Hunter's team

title: Wiegman, the major tournament magician, is in yet another final. How does she do it?
content: england manager Sarina Wiegman will lead the team to the euro 2025 final on sunday . she will face switzerland in the final on saturday night . toone says she finds it awkward, but there is no sense of self . he says she believes everyone plays his or her part in the success .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Real Madrid not giving up on Arsenal's Saliba
content: real madrid are keen on signing arsenal centre-back William Saliba . the 24-year-old impressed in last season's UEFA Champions League quarterfinal tie between the two clubs . a deal worth over €100 million wouldn't be accepted by arsenal .

title: Expert picks, best bets: How can Whittaker bounce back vs. de Ridder at UFC Fight Night?

title: Power Rankings entering Week 9: Outlaws, Atlas stay on top

title: Best of the rest: Who's left in NHL free agency?
content: all but seven NHL teams have at least $1 million to spend on their rosters . 11 teams have north of $10 million of cap space . the unrestricted pool is essentially a shallow creek with very few impactful free agents .

title: NBA execs debate the rookie class: Flagg runaway ROY? Biggest steal?
